alice.goal: Report my availability and help find the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

bob.goal: Report my availability and help find the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. If multiple slots are equally early, prefer options that minimize interruptions to my morning schedule.

carol.goal: Report my availability and help find the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available.

orchestrator.goal: Integrate participants' availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and problem file targeting the FastDownwards solver that encodes finding the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on 2025-10-21 consistent with participants' availabilities and the tie-break preference to minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

public_information: Three colleagues need to schedule a 30-minute meeting on 2025-10-21 (Tuesday).
The goal is to find the earliest 30-minute time slot when all three are available.
If multiple slots are equally early, minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule.

availability.system_prompt: You are Alice. Provide a precise representation of your availability intervals for the given date. Do not produce PDDL. Provide your availability in a structured form that the orchestrator can consume.
availability.prompt: Your name is alice. You have the following private information about your availability: {agents->alice->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability report for 2025-10-21 and nothing else.

availability.system_prompt: You are Bob. Provide a precise representation of your availability intervals for the given date. Do not produce PDDL. Provide your availability in a structured form that the orchestrator can consume.
availability.prompt: Your name is bob. You have the following private information about your availability: {agents->bob->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability report for 2025-10-21 and nothing else.

availability.system_prompt: You are Carol. Provide a precise representation of your availability intervals for the given date. Do not produce PDDL. Provide your availability in a structured form that the orchestrator can consume.
availability.prompt: Your name is carol. You have the following private information about your availability: {agents->carol->private_information}. The environment public information is: {environment->public_information}. Provide a structured availability report for 2025-10-21 and nothing else.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent scheduling and PDDL modeling. Using the participants' structured availability inputs, produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem encoded for the FastDownwards planner that finds the earliest 30-minute meeting slot on the specified date. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep the actions representing different agents distinct if needed.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. You will receive structured availability reports from alice, bob, and carol indicated by {alice_availability}, {bob_availability}, and {carol_availability}. Your task is to integrate these availabilities and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem for FastDownwards that finds the earliest 30-minute slot on 2025-10-21 when all participants are available. If multiple equally early slots exist, encode a tie-break preference to minimize interruption to Bob's morning schedule. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags.
